attributes.action: Help Save Children with Neuroblastoma
attributes.background:
Children with Neuroblastoma face many months of intense treatment but the chances of relapse are high. There is treatment in the USA that reduces this risk but that has to be funded privately.
The amount of money that is needed to pay for this runs in to hundreds of thousands of pounds.
attributes.additional_details: There have been a number of recent cases in the media where families of children with this cancer were trying to raise £550,000 to get this treatment in America. If the treatment is available to reduce the risk we should be providing that treatment here in the UK.

attributes.action: Prevent the new HS2 proposed line passing through Bramley, Rotherham
attributes.background: HS2 are proposing a new route for the line to pass through the village of Bramley. This means it will be dangerously close to local housing and other ameneties which raises a number of concerns including:- safety of local children, noise polution, negative impact on house prices, to name (but) a few

attributes.action: Hallmarks by assay offices located overseas should not be identical to UK marks.
attributes.background: In 2013 the 4 UK Assay Offices were allowed to open up sub-offices in other countries. The intention was that 'offshore' assayed items would carry a different hallmark. Birmingham Assay Office in Mumbai, India are using Birmingham hallmarks identical to the UK marks. This misleads the consumer.

attributes.action: Stop disabled parking space abuse in the UK, regardless of location or ownership
attributes.background: Many with disabilities struggle just getting in & out of a parked car, disabled bays are essential. It should be illegal for any non blue badge holder to park their car in a space reserved for those with disabilities. Without this 'The Equality Act 2010' is no longer effective.
attributes.additional_details:
Abuse of disabled parking bays is *rife all over the UK. Vehicles, skips, storage, smoking areas, temporary buildings, cancer screening/blood donor vehicles, temporary displays and more appear all too often in these bays, stopping those who NEED them from using them. Emergency Service Vehicles should ALSO have their own separate parking bay(s) to stop abuse of the disabled parking facilities - a disabled person cannot undo their disability. 

*Ref: www.facebook.com/wantmyspacetakemydisability

attributes.action: Stop the take over of Howe Barracks by the London Borough of Redbridge
attributes.background:
Over 200 families from the London Borough are set to move into the 208 homes that now sit in the Howe Barracks in Canterbury. 

Currently there are over 2,500 people on the Canterbury City Council Housing Register and surely these houses should be offered to them?
attributes.additional_details:
Let's get this discussed in Parliment as our local houses should be available to local people who need them the most.

See Kent Online for Evidence - 
http://www.kentonline.co.uk/canterbury/news/200-london-families-to-move-96359/

attributes.action: Create a fourth emergency service for people with mental health problems.
attributes.background: Patients with mental health problems are being failed since the abolition of long-term mental health hospitals and the introduction of care in the community. Care in the community is only available Monday to Friday 9-5, after which the Police, Ambulance Services and A&E staff are left to cope.
attributes.additional_details: Mental health support needs to be available 24/7.  Starting with an emergency team who are trained in mental health care and know how to cope.  The team should include someone who can reliably make a decision as to whether the patient needs to be sectioned for theirs or the publics safety and can enforce that section. Mental health problems are increasing and care in the community is clearly not working! We need to provide a more reliable support network for people with mental health problems.

attributes.action: Refuse entry to the refugees currently held up in Calais camps when they close
attributes.background:
There are currently over 5000 refugees camping at Calais. Natacha Bouchart plans to demolish these camps and send these people to the UK. She says this will happen "very soon". 
Our country is not capable of such numbers nor are we a soft touch.
This is not our problem.
attributes.additional_details:
Read the story here about the impending demolishing of the camps. 
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/calais-mayor-says-brexit-means-8408236?utm_content=buffercbf60&utm_medium=social&utm_source=facebook.com&utm_campaign=buffer

attributes.action: Keep the EU's environmental protection laws for the UK.
attributes.background:
“One just hopes that collaboration on these issues, conservation issues, will transcend political divisions” Sir David Attenborough 

A call for us to set aside our differences and secure a safe future for the environment as a nation.
attributes.additional_details:
'The EU’s record on environmental issues is arguably one of its greatest achievements. It has developed world-leading legislation on a range of issues, which have helped tackle water and air pollution, protected endangered species, and imposed tough safeguards on the use of genetically modified crops and potentially dangerous chemicals.' The Independent

Regardless of your opinions on Brexit, let us unite to secure a safe future for the environment as an independent nation.

attributes.action: Include young workers aged 18-24 in the Government's National Living Wage
attributes.background:
The National Living Wage only applies to workers aged 25+, meaning those aged 18-21 can be paid 26% less for the same work and those aged 21-24 nearly 7% less.

It also goes against the UK electorate. A Survation poll in September 2015 shows 66% of voters believe the NLW should apply to under-25s.
attributes.additional_details:
The statistics that those aged 18-21 can be paid 26% less for the same work as over 25s and those aged 21-24 nearly 7% less are worked out by calculating the percentage difference between the NLW and current NMW pay levels. Current NMW levels: 18-21(£5.30ph) and 21-24 (£6.70ph)

Link to the poll by Survation: http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2015/09/26/poll-under-25s-should-be-given-national-living-wage_n_8194992.html

attributes.action: Conduct independent review of recognition of Somaliland as independent country
attributes.background: We congratulate the people of Somaliland as they celebrate the 25th anniversary of reclaiming their independence; recognise the strong historical ties between Somaliland and UK; welcome the strong cooperation between UK Government and Somaliland through development aid, trade and security assistance

attributes.action: Discuss a northern bypass to improve traffic flow at Chichester, West Sussex.
attributes.background: The A27 is a major road connecting the towns and cities of the South Coast. At Chichester the A27 is a dual carriageway to the south which frequently becomes gridlocked. A northern bypass proposal, popular with residents, has been dropped and voting is only on the inferior southern options.
attributes.additional_details:
Please see option details and maps at
www.highways.gov.uk>roads>a27-chichester 
Please take note of the costs, the saving on journey times, environmental impact and the time taken to build the "improvements" with the subsequent traffic congestion. Although the southern options are cheaper than a northern bypass they will all be unable to cope within a few years and the whole process will begin again.
Please help our small voices be heard by joining this petition.
Many thanks for your interest.

attributes.action: Make breastfeeding education an integrated part of PSHE curriculum in schools
attributes.background: Early education on breastfeeding  can improve the general health of society, reducing the risks of obesity, infection, cancer, osteoporosis and postnatal depression rates, by increasing the likeliness of successful breastfeeding for mothers in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
http://m.unicef.org.uk/Media-centre/Press-releases-archive/Breastfeeding-could-save-the-NHS-millions-says-new-report/


http://www.cam.ac.uk/research/news/breastfeeding-linked-to-lower-risk-of-postnatal-depression

attributes.action: We want government to start consultation on the future of Sure Start Centres.
attributes.background: During the 2014 election David Cameron made a commitment that his government would not close any Sure Start Centres but they would look at starting a consultation process as to its future. We want the government to start consultation ASAP as centres are in a funding crisis and closing as a result.
attributes.additional_details:
Education starts when a child is born. It's a fact that those children using Sure Start Centres have obtained higher educational standards when entering mainstream schooling.

The government stated they would not close Sure Start Centres but funding to local authorities has reduced and as a result many have had to close. We need to look at expertise through consultation and secure funding that shows the importance of these Sure Start Centres, increase centres, give a child the best start in life.

attributes.action: We the people of Great Britain will not advocate war against Russia regardless .
attributes.background: The movement of troops and growing provocation towards Russia has not been and will not be advocated by the British people, we will not stand by and watch another senseless war with countless deaths. President Obama and his administration have an agenda, WE, the people of Great Britain do not .
attributes.additional_details:
Time and again, it has been proved that media is manipulated by government for its own gains, WE, the people of Great Britain will no longer listen to your propaganda, who knows what you greedy suits want. WE the people of Great Britain can not emphasize how important it is for you to listen to us now, DO NOT FOLLOW AMERICA TO WAR, YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED, DEMOCRACY MEANS YOU DO AS WE SAY, WE ARE WATCHING YOU, CROSS US AT YOUR PERIL. 


http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-36575180

attributes.action: Mandatory course/examination on food & drink for allergies & intolerances
attributes.background: My wife recently found out she was a Coeliac and I am allergic to nuts, as a chef I can’t believe the amount of chefs and catering staff that have no idea what these intolerance, allergies and illnesses are and how they can affect people.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe that many of the trained and un-trained catering employees don’t have training on intolerances, allergies and food based illnesses, with more and more people suffering from nut allergies, Coeliac disease, lactose intolerance, as well as the other food based allergies such as egg, soya, seafood, this issue must be dealt with before anyone else dies or becomes extremely ill.
The death of Paul Wilson who suffered a severe anaphylactic shock after ordering a meal from an Indian take away,

attributes.action: Free British citizenship for all commonwealth soldiers and veterans
attributes.background: I am a South African, living in the uk, and think it's a disgrace, that I have to pay my way to get British citizenship. I have fought for the queen in Afghanistan yet I have to now pay, to live in the county I fought for!
attributes.additional_details: The fee for a settlement application within the UK will increase to £1,875. British citizen naturalisation fees for adults will increase to £1,156 and child registration fees to £936, which also represent 25% increases.2 Mar 2016

attributes.action: Allow subsidised MoD flights for family members to visit Falklands War Graves.
attributes.background: Widows and parents of British servicemen killed in the Falklands are required to pay the full fare of £2,200 to take chartered flights to visit their loved ones’ graves. This petition requests that the MoD allow family members full access to subsidised travel for the purpose of visiting war graves.

attributes.action: Make the abuse and neglect of older people a crime
attributes.background: The constant reports of abuse and neglect of older people has gone on for too long. We are calling for such cruelty to be an aggravated criminal offence with statutory minimum sentences. This covers physical and sexual assault, financial and psychological abuse, and neglect.
attributes.additional_details: Most abusers are never charged, or if they are, they receive suspended sentences or community service. There are aggravated offences for Hate Crime, recognising basic charges are not enough. We want the same for older people. Action on Elder Abuse is a UK-wide charity that aims to protect and prevent the abuse of vulnerable older people. It has a national freephone helpline open Monday to Friday: 9:00 and 17:00 on 080 8808 8141 for confidential support and information. www.elderabuse.org.uk

attributes.action: Introduce 'Emily's Law' to ensure health and safety on privately-owned boats
attributes.background: 15 year old Emily Gardner from Gloucestershire died when her friend's boat capsized at sea. A catalogue of errors led to her death including the fact she was wearing a damaged and ill-fitting buoyancy aid. No laws currently exist to ensure that health and safety is observed on leisure craft.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/tearful-mum-watches-schoolgirls-lifeless-8088025

https://assets.digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk/media/5614f0fce5274a6251000003/MAIBInvReport21_2015.pdf

attributes.action: First aid and CPR should be taught as a mandatory part of the school curriculum.
attributes.background: People in the UK are unwilling to perform first aid - especially CPR - when required. If children were taught it at school, not only would this help those people injured in accidents or taken ill, it would also ease pressure on the already overstretched ambulance services and A&E departments.

attributes.action: Make UK political advertising subject to the Advertising Code.
attributes.background: Political campaigning is a form of advertising, and like all other forms of advertising, it should be regulated. The recent referendum campaign highlights the urgent need for political advertising to become subject to the Advertising Code in the same way as other areas of advertising and marketing.
attributes.additional_details:
The Advertising Standards Authority ensures all adverts in the UK are "legal, decent, honest and truthful", and has the power to ban false advertising. However, their powers do not currently extend to political campaigning, meaning we have more protection when buying a toaster than voting in a referendum. 

An extension of the ASA's powers would strengthen our democratic system and protect free speech. Let's remove lies from our political discourse, and kick "post-truth politics" out of Britain.

attributes.action: Recognise the UK standard of firearm deactivation as equivalent to EU standards.
attributes.background: Proposed legislation in the Policing and Crime Bill intends to enforce the application of a EU standard that will result in firearms previously deactivated to UK Home Office standards being classified as defectively deactivated.  The EU standard is inferior to the UK standard and unnecessary here.
attributes.additional_details: The UK standard of deactivation is acknowledged as the best in Europe, and makes it impossible to re-activate a firearm without completely rebuilding the weapon. Imposition of the EU standard in the UK is a complete waste of taxpayers money, is disrupting a process previously recognised by government as effective in taking live firearms out of circulation, and penalises owners by making it illegal to sell or transfer safe UK deactivated firearms that will be unfairly classified as ‘defective’.

attributes.action: To introduce a law that recognizes Parental Alienation as a criminal offence.
attributes.background: Every year thousands of children will be brainwashed against the other parent with lies. this should be recognized for the crime that it is. Child Abuse and an abuse of Human rights. Children deserve the right to both parents and parents have the right to be parents.
attributes.additional_details: Please do whats in the best interests of the children. Not the alienating parent. Give the judges the power to act against parental alienation by simply making it a criminal offence.

attributes.action: Make cannabis oil legal for medicinal purposes
attributes.background: Our daughter Sophia age 5 has a rare form of epilepsy called dravet syndrome and after exhausting every other avenue her neurologist thinks cannabis oil may be able to help her control her seizures as all medications available are not working.Please can everyone help our daughter by signing petition
attributes.additional_details: Our daughter Sophia is 5yrs old and has dravet syndrome which is a rare and refractory form of epilepsy that also affects her development. After exhausting every other avenue her neurologist feels that cannabis oil may be the key to help control her seizures. There have been many success stories regarding this medicine in America where it is currently legal in many states and also in several Europe on countries which would mean reducing/stopping several other Meds and only needing a small dose

attributes.action: Properly fund the NHS and scrap the proposed STP programme.
attributes.background: The UK spends less on health as a share of its GDP than most other G7 countries. Our NHS is under pressure as never before and is in danger of failure. The NHS is effectively only getting an increase of 0.95% per year. The STP programme will close A&E's and essential services across the country.
attributes.additional_details:
Spending on health compared to other countries:
http://www.kingsfund.org.uk/projects/nhs-in-a-nutshell/health-care-spending-compared

Effective increase of 0.95% per year for the NHS:
http://www.kingsfund.org.uk/projects/nhs-in-a-nutshell/nhs-budget

Draft sustainability and transformation plans (STPs) which propose ward closures, cuts in bed numbers and changes to A&E and GP care in 44 areas:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-37186455

attributes.action: Regulate Isle of Wight ferry prices
attributes.background: I personally want to travel to Portsmouth to see my daughter but i have to go via Southampton as i am priced out by Wightlink due to their excessive fees. The IOW residents especially need regulation to stop the companies from monopolising on the services they provide. This is one of many examples.
attributes.additional_details: Both Isle of Wight ferry companies (Red Funnel and Wightlink) are charging a lot of money to travel, especially when there is events on the Island.  This restricts people financially (especially residents as they have no choice in using these two companies) in travelling either from or to the isle of wight.  This is damaging businesses on the Island that rely on tourist trade which is in decline,  families are also restricted in seeing each other.

attributes.action: New Autism training for teachers to be designed and led by Autistic people.
attributes.background: It's been recently announced that teachers will have to learn about how they can support their students with Autism. I think that the material and delivery should be designed by people on the Autistic Spectrum. To help give staff a greater insight into the way we think.

attributes.action: The UK must put a complete Ban on  Child Immigrants from anywhere in the world
attributes.background:
The United Kingdom is no longer in a position to accept all and sundry.We have enough problems with poor educational levels and a lack of housing and jobs for the indigenous populations of England,Scotland,Wales and northern Ireland.

We must insist that the European union use the existing rules.

attributes.action: Reopen all children's centres.
attributes.background: Children’s centres serve the most deprived areas and have high levels of usage. Children attending such centres show a good level of development at EYFS, and parents show a significant improvement in parenting skills and confidence. Financial cuts are forcing many children's centres to close.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/485346/DFE-RR495_Evaluation_of_children_s_centres_in_England__the_impact_of_children_s_centres.pdf

attributes.action: Government to confirm that the June EU referendum was non-binding and advisory.
attributes.background: The government needs to publicly confirm that the referendum was merely advisory. All that is being said is that 'the people have spoken' when well over half of the electorate did not vote to leave. The govt should not assume that those who did not vote at all are not happy with the status quo.

attributes.action: NHS pensions for Dental Nurses who work in practices with an NHS contract
attributes.background:
Dental nurses across the UK are working in practices which have NHS contracts but are not entitled to an NHS pension.
Dental nurses are assisting along side Dentists who are entitled to their NHS pension so why not the nurses?

attributes.action: Make it illegal for all animal skins and furs to be imported and sold in the UK
attributes.background:
Each year 50 million animals are violently killed for use in the fashion industry. They are beaten, electrocuted and skinned alive for their skins and furs. 

The fur and skin industry is outdated, cruel and unnecessary. It must be consigned to history.
attributes.additional_details:
Cruelty Assured: http://features.peta.org.uk/origin-assured-fur/

9 Shocking Fur facts: http://www.peta.org/features/nine-shocking-fur-facts/

Fur Facts: http://www.bornfreeusa.org/facts.php?p=452&more=1

attributes.action: Provide All Children Under 16 With A Constant Glucose Monitor/Dexcom.
attributes.background:
Type One Diabetes, is a stressful, complicated disease. It is caused by the bodies immune system attacking itself, people have this disease through no fault of their own.
4 or more injections are needed daily in order for type ones to survive. As well as constant blood tests.
attributes.additional_details:
When a child is diagnosed, it is extremely difficult for a caregiver or parent to manage their Diabeties, due to them not knowing what their blood sugar levels are and will have to do more blood tests on that child than normal. A Constant Glucose Monitor, such as the Dexcom would make the child's quality of life so much better. A parent can also have some more reassurance that their child is not suffering from hypoglycaemia or hyperglycaemia. 
Type one diabetes can kill. We need this!

attributes.action: Shift Agricultural Subsidies to Support Environmental Protections post-Brexit.
attributes.background:
The government should redirect subsidies in a post-Brexit domestic agricultural policy, away from environmentally damaging farming, and towards environmental protections. 

Subsidies are needed to support farmers who tackle climate change, mitigate floods, increase biodiversity and soil health.
attributes.additional_details:
The public are understandably discouraged with the current formulation of the Common Agricultural Policy. They don’t want to see their taxes being used to line the pockets of already wealthy landowners, or to prop up failing farming industries unconditionally.

The public wants to see a domestic agricultural policy that is ahead of the curve by leading us on the path towards a low-carbon farming future, where our agricultural system provides significant benefits to the environment.

attributes.action: We want an urgent improvement in Mental Health Care in this country!
attributes.background: My 22 year old son died this year. He suffered from depression. He was denied counselling and instead was prescribed medication. He turned to drugs just before his death to help him through these dark times and I truly believe, that had he been offered urgent counselling, he would not have done so.

attributes.action: British farmers should legally have to be paid at least the cost of production.
attributes.background: Farming is one of the only industries in which businesses are paid less than the cost of production. Take the dairy industry for example; the cost of producing a pint of milk is between 25 - 33.5 pence per litre (1), yet the majority of British farmers are paid under 20 pence per litre (2
attributes.additional_details:
Continuing to use dairy as an example, since 2000, more than half of British dairy farms have closed down, reducing from over 28,000 to under 10,000 (3), and this trend shows no signs of slowing down. 'Nearly one in 10 dairy farms across England and Wales have closed in the last three years' (4).

But this doesn't just affect dairy farmers, there are forecasts that the income for many others are due to drop by the following amounts this year alone (5):
Cereals down 24%
General cropping down 17%
Pigs down 46%

attributes.action: Save Newholme hospital from closure
attributes.background: Bakewell will lose all its facilities at Newholme hospital under the ‘Better Care Closer to Home’ proposal made by the government. This includes rehabilitation for inpatients along with care for mental health and dementia.
attributes.additional_details:
Other services are also provided for the surrounding community including physiotherapy, podiatry, and other day care services. 
Losing this hospital with the valuable services that it provides would be a massive loss to the local people. Please help to prevent the closure by signing the petition to save Newholme hospital.

attributes.action: Training Paediatric Medical Professionals in Diagnosing Craniosynostosis
attributes.background: Craniosynostosis is a skull condition that causes a baby to be born with, or develop an abnormally shaped head. The irregular skull shape causes severe symptoms resulting from increased pressure in the skull, it affects 1 in every 3,000 babies born each year but is a largely unheard of condition.
attributes.additional_details: Lucy's Head Start is campaigning for mandatory training for paediatric medical professionals leading to earlier diagnosis.Families involved with Lucy's Head Start have reported that some but not all midwives, health vistors or GPs have dismissed, missed, misdiagnosed or mistaken their child's condition for flat head due to lack of awareness, which is why we desperately need mandatory training.Most children diagnosed require surgery and early intervention is vital to prevent severe symptoms.

attributes.action: Immediate dismissal of Iraq Historic Allegations Team and Operation Northmoor
attributes.background: Mothers of soldiers killed in Afghanistan and Iraq are "astonished and appalled" at failures to scrap criminal inquiries against veterans. Cases include a Taliban bombmaker who claims his detention for 106 days was illegal, despite troops' belief he would kill British soldiers if they released him.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/09/21/revealed-now-british-troops-face-criminal-investigation-over-tal/
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/09/22/mothers-of-dead-servicemen-to-demand-showdown-with-theresa-may-a/
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/09/22/british-soldiers-who-fought-in-iraq-and-afghanistan-face-having/

attributes.action: UK Government Introduce Licensing for all Air Weapons and Protect our Cats
attributes.background: The Air Weapons and Licensing (Scotland) Act 2015 comes fully into effect on 31 December 2016.  The new law will require any person who possesses, purchases, uses or acquires an air weapon to have a certificate to hold them legally. We ask that the same be introduced in England and Wales.
attributes.additional_details: Research by Feline welfare charity Cats Protection found more cats are killed in air gun attacks than 20 years ago -  In 2016 46 per cent of air gun wounds proved fatal for cats compared to 11 per cent in 1996.The findings are particularly concerning, given a leading criminologist has warned that some people who shoot cats could go on to commit similar crimes against humans. We are calling for stricter regulation on the ownership of air guns, as we strongly believe this will help to protect cats and other members of our communities from attacks.

attributes.action: NHS trusts/deaneries should make adequate provision for post-night shift rest
attributes.background: A Doctors.net.uk survey showed 41% doctors have fallen asleep after a night shift.  This is most prevalent amongst pre-consultant grade doctors, who can change hospital every 3-4 months, resulting in a long commute and no access to public transport, making night shifts inherently dangerous.
attributes.additional_details:
The need to change place of work so frequently is unique to doctors in training, and whilst other professions do have night shifts, the ensuing length of commute (average of 25 miles) increases the risk to doctors, with 29% knowing a colleague who died driving after a night shift.  Over half never have access to an on-call room with, or without a bed (52% and 57% respectively).  Only 27% had access to paid on-site accommodation.  
Source: Doctors.net.uk survey, July 2016, n=1,135

attributes.action: Ask the PM to explain the deception on the true legal status of the EU vote.
attributes.background: The Referendum was an advisory Consultation, not a binding vote. Noone neither Government nor MP's nor Civil Service, raised this fundamental point publicly before the vote. And have not confirmed it since. Why not? Was or is there a Conspiracy of Silence ordered by No. 10?
attributes.additional_details:
1.The EU Referendum Act 2015.
2. House of Commons Briefing Paper CBP-7212, June 2015, Section 5:
“Types of referendum:
This Bill ...does not contain any requirement for the UK Government to implement the results of the referendum, nor set a time limit by which a vote to leave the EU should be implemented. Instead, this is a type of referendum known as pre-legislative or consultative, which enables the electorate to voice an opinion which then influences the Government in its policy decisions."

attributes.action: Save Bolsover Community Hospital from closure
attributes.background: Bolsover community hospital is under threat from the public services cuts imposed by the current government. We need your help in saving our hospital which provides fantastic services and relieves the pressure on the larger hospitals which are already under strain.
attributes.additional_details: Bolsover community hospital is under threat of closure from the severe cuts facing all public services. The hospital offers physiotherapy treatment and advice, intermediate care services aiming to prevent people from being admitted to hospital which is essential for all major hospitals in the current financial climate and mental health services for the elderly which are essential in any community. Bolsover has lost a lot over the years, let's not add our hospital to the ever growing list.

attributes.action: Department of Transport to look into the service run by Abellio Greater Anglia.
attributes.background: Today train services were severely disrupted by overhead power cable failures. Even though Network Rail maintain these, the rolling stock is beyond fit for purpose with passengers sweltering in carriages.

attributes.action: Protect our freedom to collect wild food from common land for personal use.
attributes.background: In light of the Forestry commission's unscientific & undemocratic decision to ban fungi picking in the New Forest, against the weight of evidence, we the undersigned demand the government enact legal protections for our rights to forage for personal use as per those detailed in the theft act 1968.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.conservationevidence.com/individual-study/230
25 year longitudinal study, showing mushroom picking has no effect on the fungal ecosystem.

Ref: 'New Forest fungi picking ban "unscientific" say fungi experts'

http://www.foragers-association.org.uk/index.php/press/new-forest-fungi-picking-ban-press-release

swedish model of "everyman's right"

http://www.sverigeturism.se/smorgasbord/smorgasbord/natrecspo/nature/every.html

Theft act: http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/1968/60/contents

attributes.action: Give psv holders class 2 entitlement.
attributes.background: A PSV holder is a person who holds a licence to drive a bus, with this they can drive any type of bus from a minibus & double decker, right up to a bendy bus. They carry very precious cargo (the general public). But yet holders of these licences can't drive a class 2 lorry. It doesn't make sense.
attributes.additional_details:
For example,
Bus length - 12 metres,
Class 2 lorry - 7.9 metres

Bus weight - 14 ton
Class 2 lorry weight - 7.5 ton

Bus contents - passengers
Class 2 content - packages and goods

If for example you drive a bendy bus, you need similar skills to a class 1 lorry driver in relation to length and reversing. 

My argument is that psv drivers are more highly trained and skilled than a class 2 driver because of the contents and vehicle sizes, and they should automatically have class 2 entitlement.

attributes.action: Require proof of identity to be provided by all voters in the EU Referendum.
attributes.background: More examples have been found of blatant fraud at polling stations where people who have turned up to vote are turned away having been marked as "already voted".
attributes.additional_details: These days, providing proof of identity is normal almost everywhere. Requiring proof of identity at the polling station ought to be mandatory for everyone who wants to vote, but especially in the EU Referendum, as a further guard against the fraudulent practices now rife throughout the United Kingdom and widely expected to occur during the Brexit vote.

attributes.action: Make it a law for vets to scan pets each time they visit.
attributes.background: I want to make it a law that all pets must be scanned when they visit the vet. This will majorly decrease the chances of lost or stolen pets slipping the net and not finding their way home. By scanning a pet each time, these pet's owners can be traced meaning many broken families can be reunited.

attributes.action: Urge the Nigerian Government to stop the massacre of Igbos
attributes.background: Since the beginning of the year, there has been a number of attacks by Fulani herds men, on indigenous Igbo population in the east of Nigeria. The most recent, being an attack on the Nimbo Community in Enugu during which over 50 people lost their lives, several injured and properties destroyed.
attributes.additional_details: Of all these attacks, the Federal Government of Nigeria has been silence. Rather, the federal house is pushing ahead with a bill that will give the herds men full right to graze their cattle's on peoples farm lands. Similar petition is already going on and gathering signatures in the White House. We are appealing to the UK parliament to use its influence to make the Nigeria Government address these killings before it degenerates to inter tribal attacks.

attributes.action: Enable police to chase motorcycle thief's not wearing a crash helmet
attributes.background:
At present police,are not allowed to chase a motorcycle thief who is not wearing a crash helmet.
This law has seen a high rise in motorcycle theft.
Without a change in the law this epidemic will continue to grow
